name: py-myst-parser

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
A Sphinx and Docutils extension to parse MyST, a rich and extensible
flavour of Markdown for authoring technical and scientific
documentation.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-docutils
dependencies.description:
Docutils is an open-source text processing system for processing
plaintext documentation into useful formats, such as HTML, LaTeX, man-
pages, open-document or XML. It includes reStructuredText, the easy to
read, easy to use, what-you-see-is-what-you-get plaintext markup
language.

dependencies.name: py-jinja2
dependencies.description:
Jinja2 is a template engine written in pure Python. It provides a Django
inspired non-XML syntax but supports inline expressions and an optional
sandboxed environment.

dependencies.name: py-markdown-it-py
dependencies.description:
Markdown parser, done right. 100% CommonMark support, extensions, syntax
plugins & high speed

dependencies.name: py-mdit-py-plugins
dependencies.description: Collection of core plugins for markdown-it-py

dependencies.name: py-pyyaml
dependencies.description: PyYAML is a YAML parser and emitter for Python.

dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions
dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).
